concise_definition: adj. 凉爽的, 冷静的, 酷的, 时髦的; v. 冷却, 镇静

definitions.explanation_en: Having a low temperature; not hot or warm, often providing comfort or relief from heat.
definitions.explanation_cn: 温度较低的，不热或不暖的，常用于提供凉爽或缓解炎热的感觉。
definitions.example_en: The water from the spring was refreshingly cool.

definitions.explanation_en: Calm, composed, and not easily excited or emotional; showing self-control in stressful situations.
definitions.explanation_cn: 冷静、镇定、不易激动或情绪化；在压力情境下表现出自制力。
definitions.example_en: She stayed cool under pressure during the negotiation.

definitions.explanation_en: Fashionable, stylish, or admired for being trendy and appealing, especially among young people.
definitions.explanation_cn: 时尚的、有型的，因符合潮流而受到赞赏，尤其在年轻人中流行。
definitions.example_en: Those sneakers are so cool — everyone wants a pair.
definitions.example_cn: 那双运动鞋太酷了——人人都想买一双。

definitions.explanation_en: To reduce in temperature, either naturally or by external means, often to make something more comfortable or safe.
definitions.explanation_cn: 通过自然方式或外部手段降低温度，通常是为了使某物更舒适或更安全。
definitions.example_en: Let the soup cool before you taste it.

definitions.explanation_en: To become less intense, excited, or angry; to calm down emotionally.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指情绪、热情或愤怒减弱，变得平静下来。
definitions.example_en: He needed some time to cool down after the argument.
definitions.example_cn: 争吵后，他需要一些时间来平复情绪。

comparison.analysis: “Cold” (冷的) 是一个更中性或客观的温度描述，通常指温度极低，可能带有负面含义（如冷酷、无情）。而 “cool” 是相对温和的低温，常带有积极或舒适的情感色彩，如凉爽宜人或冷静沉着。
“Calm” (平静的) 专指情绪或环境的安宁，强调无波动、无干扰的状态。而 “cool” 在情绪语境中不仅指平静，还隐含一种自信、不慌乱甚至带点疏离感的镇定，常用于形容在压力下仍保持风度的人。
“Trendy” (时髦的) 仅指跟随当前流行趋势，偏重于外在的时尚性，有时带有短暂或肤浅的贬义。而 “cool” 不仅包含时尚，还融合了个性、态度和文化认同，是一种更深层、更持久的吸引力，常超越潮流本身。
